Vaudevillian
2:00pm show
I have updated information about tickets. They are now making advanced buying available online. I have reserved mine. If you plan to reserve your ticket, you don't have to get down there as early, just half hour before the show. Tickets are going fast, you may still have a chance to try for the "Pay What You can" ticket, you will have to be down there one hour before the show to purchase a first come first serve spot. I will be down there at 1:00pm to wait with those buying last minute for the show.

Reserved entry is $15. Online ticket buying starts 10/5. PAY-WHAT-YOU-CAN is first come, first serve one hour prior to each show.

FOR TICKETS: http://brokenumbrella...

A BROKEN UMBRELLA THEATRE PRESENTS THE ALMOST ENTIRELY TRUE STORY OF A 1913 WESTVILLE MURDER THIS OCTOBER!

Cops & Criminals…
Headlines & Handcuffs…
Villains & Vaudeville…
From the team that transformed the tunnel in Edgewood Park into a pirate’s lair with their sold-out 2009 spectacle Thunderbolt, comes A Broken Umbrella Theatre’s newest creation VaudeVillain.

This fall, the line between fact and fiction thins to a blur when the public is lead on a “who done it?” psychological adventure traveling through every room in Lyric Hall Antiques & Conservation on October 23, 24, 30 and 31.

Ripped from the actual New Haven headlines of 1913, mystery and mayhem abound as we follow the trail of the suspected murderer from song to scene to sensational dream. The past meets the present during a surreal finale in the beautifully restored West Rock vaudeville theatre, newly renamed The Showroom at Lyric Hall. Not recommended for ages 10 and below.

*Not recommended for ages 10 and below.

*Performances*
Saturday, October 23 at 7pm & 9pm
Sunday, October 24 at 2pm & 6pm.
Saturday, October 30 & Sunday, October 31 at 2pm, 6pm & 8pm

LIMITED SEATING!
Ticket distribution starts one hour prior to the start of each show on a first come, first served basis for pay what you can tickets.
